title: Is a black hole really a hole? - Quora

response.answer_text: Is a black hole really a hole? Well, is a hole really a hole? A hole in a surface is a gap in it that forms a passage from one side to the other without going over its edge.A hole in the ground is is depression that doesn’t allow passage in any direction other than down... and then back up again, if you can find the means to climb.A hole in a box is a way into, or out of the enclosed space defined by the walls of the box.All three of these examples are different things. Going into the hole has a different outcome in every case, but they’re all described using the same noun - hole. This is a linguistic limitation, because clearly the word is not enough to describe the condition in full. Saying “I found a hole…” doesn’t tell anyone what kind of thing it is you found. Is it 1,2, or 3? In the case of a Black Hole, the term was applied because the effect of gravity is to pull you down into it. Unlike most holes though, since it appears nothing that goes in comes back out, there was (and still is) no way of knowing whether it’s type 1 or 2 or 3. Our logical experience would tell us that all the stuff going in can’t just vanish and would eventually fill up any hole of type 2 or 3, so the stuff that goes in must come out somewhere - and those who subscribe to that view will suggest therefore that it allows passage to a different side of the universe. It could be type 2, if you can accept that the more stuff you put into the hole, the deeper it gets. This is counter-intuitive to experience, but makes sense if you believe spacetime is stretchy. Every bit of mass that falls in stretches the hole downwards a bit more, so there’s always enough room for more to fall in. Type 3 is similar, but the box can’t expand so you have to consider that there’s no limit to how tightly the stuff can squeeze together if it falls into the box. Or maybe it’s type 4. Something entirely new, a kind of hole we can’t really describe because it’s using a dimension we don’t understand to accomodate all the matter that goes into it. In any case, we can still call it a hole. Things can go into it, and that’s a common factor. I’m happy to live with the idea it’s a hole of some kind. We now know that at least something, Hawking radiation, can come out of it too. I don’t pretend to understand physics at this level, but that’s something wonderfully exciting to me. And at last we have a photo of what surrounds a black hole, and can see its shadow, so we’re entering a new phase of discovery.

A gravitational singularity or space-time singularity is a location in space-time where the gravitational field of a celestial body becomes infinite in a way that does not depend on the coordinate system. The quantities used to measure gravitational field strength are the scalar invariant curvatures of space-time, which includes a measure of the density of matter. Since such quantities become infinite within the singularity, the laws of normal space-time could not exist.
